image.altText: Three firefighters with hoses trying to put out an underground fire

props.synopsis: A fire that began in suspicious circumstances is still burning underground south of Bunbury, despite the best efforts of firefighters and one of the wettest winters on record.

title.children: One of WA's longest-burning fires is still smouldering after a million litres of water

image.altText: A rainbow flag

props.synopsis: The Western Australian government says it "won't have time" to pass a ban on gay conversion therapy before next year's state election, despite a promise made two years ago.

title.children: Western Australia pushes back plan to ban gay conversion therapy

image.altText: Two power workers in a cherry picker drain water from an insulator on a power pole.

props.synopsis: A planned short power outage for some Perth residents in the northern suburb of Heathridge turned into days without electricity and damaged home appliances.

title.children: Routine transformer upgrade leaves Perth street 'popping, fizzing and smelling smoke'

image.altText: A field of colourful flowers with a hill in the distance against a cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: An array of colourful flora has transformed Western Australia's countryside despite fears this year's wildflower season would be a bust.

title.children: Wildflower season in full bloom after record rain in WA's Midwest

image.altText: A woman with brown short hair sits behind a microphone

props.synopsis: The public service commissioner names former department bosses Kathryn Campbell and Renee Leon among a dozen current and former senior public servants found to have breached their duties in relation to the unlawful Robodebt scheme.Â

title.children: Kathryn Campbell and Renee Leon breached duties over Robodebt, public service commissioner finds

image.altText: Ilya Fomin stands near a front door

props.synopsis: Despite consulting with bank staff before transferring his life savings, Ilya Fomin lost $280,000 to scammers. His bank hasn't accepted any responsibility â new scam laws may change that.Â

title.children: Ilya's life savings were stolen when he transferred $280K from NAB to Commonwealth Bank. Both banks and his law firm say it's not their fault

image.altText: An elderly Aboriginal man in a business shirt and a cowboy hat standing in front of a vacant lot.

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal elder says a fine handed to City of Kalgoorlie-Boulder will not deter others from damaging Aboriginal heritage sites.

title.children: 'Slap on the wrist': WA council fined $5k for damaging Aboriginal heritage site

image.altText: A man with tattoos on his shoulders sits in a bath and looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: Clearance divers have among the highest suicide rates of all defence personnel. An ABC investigation has spoken to more than a dozen former divers experiencing a cluster of symptoms they believe is connected to blast exposure.

title.children: These men knew signing up to the Navy would be risky. The toll on their brains wasn't revealed until years later

image.altText: A close up of Yvonne Buters wearing a black shirt with white flowers on it, looking directly into the camera.

props.synopsis: Stronger protections for older Australians and hefty fines for providers who breach standards are part of the federal government's sweeping changes to the aged care sector.Â

image.altText: A mosaic of news photos, some fake and AI-created, including one of Taylor Swift, with blue ticks and red exclamation marks

title.children: Most Australians struggle to spot what's real and what's fake. Here's some help

image.altText: Police officers surround a woman in a car.

props.synopsis: A woman who set her hand in concrete as part of a protest against the Land Forces expo has been arrested by police as the demonstration against the event continues for a third day.

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers, Minister for Aged Care Anika Wells and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese

image.altText: Ukrainian servicemen ride a military vehicle.

title.children: 'They will outnumber them': Russia begins counter-offensive in Kursk

image.altText: A stocky man in sunglasses walks down a flight of stairs.

props.synopsis: A man who restrained three young children in WA's north after he found them swimming in his pool has faced trial, with his defence lawyer arguing he is "a victim of crime".

image.altText: main pic of the two

props.synopsis: The Miss Universe Fiji voting drama has seen accusations of racism, vote-rigging, conflicts of interest and "conspiracy theories". But in Fiji, the saga is triggering a different kind of response: one of embarrassment and anger.Â

title.children: Miss Universe Fiji scandal erupts as 'runner up' claims she's the winner two weeks after the event

image.altText: A tight selfie shot of a man smiling outdoors.

image.altText: A man in a blue jacket and light pants stands bathed in light at the end of a black tunnel underground.

image.altText: Council members and staff sit around a round table. More more than 60 chairs arranged in three rows around it.

image.altText: King Charles said the hug with the New Zealand rugby players was "healing".
